amendment.description: To protect and retain our Children's Health Insurance Program for 4 years (PRO-CHIP).

action.text: Amendment SA 1115 ruled out of order by the chair.
Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 1115 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 138.
Point of order that the amendment violates the CBA raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 1115.
Amendment SA 1115 proposed by Senator Bennet. (consideration: CR S2157-2158) To protect and retain our Children's Health Insurance Program for 4 years (PRO-CHIP).
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 1115 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 138.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1115 proposed by Senator Bennet.
